pane-node-vimn-article-copy"  >                <div class="pane-content">     <div class="content-copy-text"><p>The last <a href="/harry-potter" data-subject-uuid="75626130-acb2-4833-a62c-d9f1888833b3" title="Harry Potter" itemscope="" itemtype="http://schema.org/Movie">Harry Potter</a> book may have been released over eight years ago, but that doesn’t mean the crazy theories about the series are going to stop anytime soon.</p> <p>Still, this latest idea has got fans properly losing their minds, as some genius has made a connection between The Tale of the Three Brothers and Professor Dumbledore.</p> <p><div class="vimn-files-image-embed"><span data-picture=""> <span data-src="http://www.mtv.co.uk/sites/default/files/styles/vimn_image_embed/public/mtv_uk/articles/2015/08/07/dumbledore.jpg?itok=HCYYbgpJ" ></span> <span data-media="all and (min-width : 0px) and (max-width : 519px)" data-src="http://www.mtv.co.uk/sites/default/files/styles/image-w-520-scale/public/mtv_uk/articles/2015/08/07/dumbledore.jpg?itok=VpxJA9M3" ></span> <span data-media="all and (min-width : 520px) and (max-width : 759px)" data-src="http://www.mtv.co.uk/sites/default/files/styles/image-w-760-scale/public/mtv_uk/articles/2015/08/07/dumbledore.jpg?itok=cBxkYX1z" ></span> <span (max-width : 1299px)" data-src="http://www.mtv.co.uk/sites/default/files/styles/image-w-760-scale/public/mtv_uk/articles/2015/08/07/dumbledore.jpg?itok=cBxkYX1z" ></span> <span data-media="all and (min-width : 1300px)" data-src="http://www.mtv.co.uk/sites/default/files/styles/image-w-900-scale/public/mtv_uk/articles/2015/08/07/dumbledore.jpg?itok=dRJn3ZlZ" ></span> <noscript><img src="http://www.mtv.co.uk/sites/default/files/styles/vimn_image_embed/public/mtv_uk/articles/2015/08/07/dumbledore.jpg?itok=HCYYbgpJ" alt="" /></noscript> </span></div>If you aren’t up to date with your Hazza P knowledge, The Tale of the Three Brothers is a story within a story, where a trio of siblings are able to cheat Death – but not for long.</p> <p>Two end up being caught, but the last one survives thanks to an invisibility cloak. Eventually, the surviving brother takes off the cloak and gives it to his son, and the story says he then ‘greeted Death as an old friend, and went with him gladly, and, as equals, they departed this life.”</p> <p>Pretty intense, eh?</p> <p>Well, Tumblr user Harryjxmespotter has gone ahead and claimed that the three brothers in the story are actually Snape, Voldemort and Harry, with Dumbledore actually representing Death.</p> <p><div class="vimn-files-image-embed"><span data-picture=""> <span data-src="http://www.mtv.co.uk/sites/default/files/styles/vimn_image_embed/public/mtv_uk/articles/2015/08/07/screen-shot-2015-08-06-at-6-22-35-am.png?itok=PvtT2vRP" ></span> <span data-media="all and
